meanings.definition: To admit or place in a hospital for medical care.
meanings.sent1: The doctor decided to hospitalize the patient for further tests.
meanings.sent2: When I fell and broke my arm, I had to hospitalize for a few days.
meanings.sent3: Why did the clumsy clown hospitalize himself after tripping over his own shoes?
meanings.sent4: Her migraine was so severe that it felt like a tiny construction worker was hospitalizing her head.
meanings.sent5: The image of the injured bird hospitalizing itself in the nest stayed with me for days.

meanings.definition: To be admitted to a hospital for medical treatment.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, the injured man had to hospitalize immediately.
meanings.sent2: When the flu symptoms worsened, she knew it was time to hospitalize.
meanings.sent3: The cat pretended to hospitalize itself at the vet's office to avoid taking a bath.
meanings.sent4: The storm hospitalized the city, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The idea of being hospitalizing in a foreign country made her nervous but also curious.
